item.title: Add integration tests to an existing .NET 6 Web API using Entity Framework, Identity and JWTs
item.description: Test the full lifecycle of your API controllers using integration tests. Combined with in-memory databases you can fully mock your system and reproducible results. This approach even deals with cookies, so you can authenticate using a JWT in a cookie.

item.title: Validate JWT cookies sent to an Azure Functions application
item.description: Validate JWTs as cookies, that are sent to an Azure Functions application

item.title: Configure Vue.js with environment variables
item.description: Inject environment specific settings into your Vue.js build, allowing you to change key configuration such as API endpoints

item.title: Generate a .NET 6 Web API Typescript client from an OpenAPI / Swagger definition
item.description: Turn your swagger.json file into a fully configured typescript API service, that you can instantly integrate into your JavaScript application

item.title: (Part 4) Amend JWTs to work securely with SPAs in a .NET 6 Web API
item.description: Change how we handle JWTs so that they can be securely used by SPAs rather than the standard API lifecycle

item.title: (Part 3) Add JWT based authentication and authorization to a .NET 6 Web API
item.description: Authenticate and authorize users calling your .NET 6 Web API by using JSON Web Tokens (JWTs)

item.title: (Part 2) Add .NET Identity roles to a .NET 6 Web API
item.description: Manage your user’s roles on a .NET Web API using .NET Identity

item.title: (Part 1) Add .NET Identity login and registration to a .NET 6 Web API
item.description: Manage the login and registration of your users on a .NET Web API using .NET Identity

item.title: Adding app settings and user secrets to an Azure Functions project
item.description: How to separate the concerns of environment configuration and application configuration in an azure functions project and distribute sensitive settings via user secrets and environment variables.

item.title: Heatmaps By Hexos
item.description: Running between 2019 and 2022, Hexos was a UK provider of realistic driving and public transport based heatmaps/travel-time maps for data visualisation.

item.title: Semantic Versioning
item.description: How to correctly version things using the x.y.z format

item.title: Introduction to Git Flow
item.description: Introducing GitFlow, a well established method of branching in a git repository with multiple members

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Dom! I’m a Junior Software Engineer studying Computer Science at the University of Sheffield whilst on placement at 3squared. I have a wide range of experience across different platforms, languages and frameworks but I am currently specialising in C#, .NET and Vue.js development. Experience 3squared (2021-present) - Junior Software Engineer 3Squared supply expert consultancy & technology solutions developed to tackle known and emerging rail challenges.

item.title: Llama Physics Engine
item.description: It’s llamas and physics. Who knows what could happen?
